Game

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • Game.MoveableCharacter
            • Game.Sprite
              • Game.Player
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable

    public class Player
extends Sprite
    This class represents a player in the game.

    It handles its connection and communication to the server, its movement, its state (such as the amount of health left) and its actions (such as attacking the other characters)
    Author:
    Sitton
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • sendData

        public void sendData(int newX,
                     int newY)
        send data to the server.
        In the game, the data sent to the the server is represented like this:

        "[newX,newY]_attackingChar\n"

        So if for example my character moved from (0,0) to (10,12),and did not make an attempt to attack, the data to be sent to the server will look like this:
        "[10,12]_N\n"
        Parameters:
        newX - - the new x coordinate of the player.
        newY - - the new y coordinate of the player.

      • recieveData

        public java.lang.String recieveData()
        Receive data from the server.
        The data should look like this: "[newX1,newY1]_attk ~ [newX2,newY2]_attk ~ [newX3,newY3]_attk ~ [newX4,newY4]_attk ~\n"

        These numbers represent the locations of the 4 players at the given time, and the "attk" represents the attackingChars field of the players.

        An example input for 4 players could look like this:
        [100,350]_N ~ [529,350]_F ~ [958,350]_N ~ [1290,350]_N ~\n
        Returns:
        - a string representing the locations of all players

      • attack

      • looseHealth

        public void looseHealth()
        Reduce the value of health by 1 and set the costume constant to 2 for a short time in order to use the correct type of costume
        See Also:
        Sprite.costumeConst

      • moveToLocation

        public void moveToLocation(int newX,
                           int newY)
        This method moves the MoveableCharacter to the target (x,y) position.

        In addition, it updates the Sprite.currentColumn and Sprite.currentRow fields of the Sprite in order to fit to the correct costume of the movement.

        In addition to that, this method moves the attacks of the Player note - in case the player's health is 0, this method will move him to his death position
        Overrides:
        moveToLocation in class Sprite
        Parameters:
        newX - - the desired x location to the MoveableCharacter to be at
        newY - - the desired y location to the MoveableCharacter to be at
        See Also:
        Sprite.COSTUMES
